page.title: 09Churches and ancient houses
page.content: At Langford {ST GILES CHURCH }dates back to Norman times. It looks like a normal interesting church until we look at its western end.There is a semi-circular Norman apse at the wrong (western) side of the church:this is unique in western Europe. At Beeleigh there is a lovely house which is the remains of an abbey built by the {PREMONSTRATENSIAN CANONS }in 1180 The main hall remains but is now lined with books since Christina Foyle lives there : She owns the world famous bookshop - Foyles of London.
